Spreadsheets can be a good starting point, but they can get cumbersome quickly.

Toggl is an excellent choice, and I'm happy to report that it does have a feature to track time offline!

**Offline Time Tracking in Toggl:**

Toggl's browser extension and mobile apps allow you to track time even when you're offline. Here's how it works:

1. **Browser Extension:** When you're offline, the Toggl browser extension will continue to track your time locally on your device. Once you reconnect to the internet, the tracked time will be synced with your Toggl account.
2. **Mobile Apps:** Toggl's mobile apps (iOS and Android) also allow offline time tracking. You can track time on the go, even without an internet connection. When you reconnect to the internet, the tracked time will be synced with your Toggl account.

This feature is super useful when you're working remotely, traveling, or experiencing internet connectivity issues.

**Additional Toggl Features:**

1. **Auto-track:** Toggl's auto-track feature allows you to automatically track time spent on tasks based on your activity. This feature is available on the browser extension and mobile apps.
2. ** Pomodoro Timer:** Toggl has a built-in Pomodoro timer that helps you stay focused and take regular breaks.
3. **Integrations:** Toggl integrates with over 100 tools and platforms, including popular project management tools like Asana, Trello, and Basecamp.
4. **Reporting and Analytics:** Toggl provides detailed reports and analytics to help you understand how you're spending your time.

Give Toggl a try, and I'm sure you'll find it to be a significant upgrade from using a spreadsheet! If you have any more questions or need help with getting started, feel free to ask!
